description: It is easy to create a new database but I haven't been able to import my data despite numerous attempts. I tried using different settings for the columns types to ensure it should support the amount of data and the type of data the columns contain, I also tried importing the data in different formats, but nothing worked. Every single time it kept having errors. If I didn't need to import my data into it, I'm sure it would be perfectly fine and work well entering new data into it, so that's the only thing I think it's good for. That same data imported just fine in Kexi when I used the CSV format, so I recommend using Kexi over LibreOffice Base.
Well, it doesn't start after install via snap store on Ubuntu. It's probably OK and just needs the snap issue is sorted out

does not do with big files so only limited to 7 entries, may work better without photos, but then it is useless if you want collections on it, and various other info

description: I was trying to make a new form for a data base and the wizard won't finish so it is useless. Also whenever I try to save it always gives an error. Maybe I don't know how to use it but it seems that maybe it could be a bit more user friendly.
apparently unsupported

I switched our database systems from Access across to LibreOffice Base with SQLite about four years ago in line with a switch to Ubuntu. At the time Base tended to be perhaps a little difficult to work with and often unstable. But the Base developers have really been working on it, making constant improvements and it is now stable and reliable with new features. It is a good alternative to Access and like all systems requires a little effort to familiarize oneself, but it is well worth it.
summary: A good workhorse which is improving all the time

description: overall great product

The program once you get it working is fine. But getting it working is a challenge if you aren't fluid in the terminal commands to install apps in linux. The real issue is that Java has to be installed in the Linux environment for the base program to function. Virtually every window will fail if Java isn't installed and it takes some looking at the error to realize you need to have Java Installed to get it working.
summary: Base is a Good product, but challenging installation

description:
Hi all!

If you would end up with No SDBC driver was found for the URL 'sdbc:embedded:hsqldb', the missing part can be installed from command line with the following (Ubuntu 20.04)
sudo apt install libreoffice-sdbc-hsqldb
Works for me afterwards.
love the grafics
summary: great app but why is there an other Isaac

description:
Three steps of scoring:

LO is a great MSOffice replacement. I use mostly Calc and Writer, and overall it does what it should, it does it well, although there's room for improvement. E.g. cell borders in Calc is impressively clunky to use.
- Score for being a good MSOffice replacement: 4/5

In KDE, this Snap (like most others) is seemingly unable to theme correctly. It inherits dark theme, but doesn't find the dark icons.
On the positive side, you're not forced to use the GTK theme/style, so at least there's progress.
- Score for not being able to theme correctly: 3/5

The fact that all settings with regards to dates, units and such doesn't (by default) adhere to ISO standards, but instead use the archaic "imperial" system (inches, sunday as first day of week, mm-dd-yyyy for date), is a bit embarassing in 2021. Especially considering that The Document Foundation is based in Germany!
- Score for not using ISO standards/for using outdated units of measurements and dates: 2/5
summary: Great, but no Dark icons and doesn't use ISO units as default

description:
Work with tables of any length and the copy & paste import export methods just crash leaving you without a method.
Its the worst thing and one many who need a database GUI will likely hit at one time or another.
It would get 2 more stars if not for that but for me so important why it doesn't import and export from files is a huge problem for a GUI DB editor.
summary: Not so great from the Libre guys

description: I spent years working with this product replacing Access, FormMaker and other applications I had made throughout the years. This was a real challenge early on in its infancy but I kept at it! It was love hate in the beginning but turned into an excellent replacement for Microsoft Access and the entire LibreOffice suite covers the rest of MSOffice products. Can't say enough good about this product, its support, the connectors, report writer, templates and more. It has been a pleasure to work with it, kudos to the team.
summary: Excellent replacement for FormMaker, Access and more!

description: Fantastic, full-featured "office" application suite. Of course they take some getting used to for those familiar with alternatives since there are so many menu options. Almost every feature you can expect is here and is easy to use.

Very disappointing. Calc works well and I wanted to create a data source using base to a MYSQL database.

It seems to install OK but cannot launch. Not a lot of help around to solve it.
summary: Base does not launch in Ubuntu 18.04

description: It crashes constantly
Libreoffice benutze ich lieber als Microsoft Office. Selbst wenn ich auf meinen PC Win 10 habe.

LibreOffice ist ein sehr gutes und freies Programm und für alle kostenlos nutzbar! Würde auf jeden Fall weiter empfehlen. LibreOffice macht da weiter wo OpenOffice versagt hat. Frei zugänglich für alle!

Ich habe jahrelang mit Microsoft Produkten gearbeitet, welche auch zugegebenermaßen sehr gut funktionieren. Jetzt ist es aber an der Zeit für die Freiheit aufzustehen und Monopolisten in ihre Schranken zu weisen.
Die willkürlichen Sperrungen bei Twitter, Facebook, Google und Co haben mich zu dem Schritt bewogen, auf Linux und somit Freiheit zu setzen.
Dazu gehört auch freie Software wie LibreOffice.
LibreOffice Base zürzt laufend auf Ubuntu 21.10 ab und lässt sich danach nicht wieder herstellen.
shabdeguolao caonm

Ich arbeite seit vielen Jahren sehr gerne mit Libre Office und
habe auch Datenbanken damit bearbeitet. Seit der Integra-
tion von Firebird ist sie nicht mehr einsetzbar. Denn nach 
einiger Zeit lässt sich diese nicht mehr öffnen und zeigt 
Fehler seitens Firebird. Sie hingt in ihrer Entwicklung der
Access Datenbank auch nach. Deshalb kann man diese Daten-
bank derzeit nicht für den professionellen Einsatz empfehlen. 
Die anderen Module von Libre Office sind dagegen top.

Usability auf Level 90er/00er Jahre, wo MS Access damals war. Beispiel: Tabellenentwurfsansicht. Macht die Spalten für den Feldbezeichner und den Typ viel zu schmal und das jedesmal, wenn ich das Ding wieder aufmache, so daß ich es jedesmal wieder auseindanderzupfen muß. Was soll das? Eine Datenbank über die GUI anzulegen, dauert bis ins nächste Jahrtausend. Ich wollte direkt dazu übergehen, meine Datenbank direkt mit SQL einzugeben. Aber das Handbuch dazu ist SCHROTT!. Es ist nicht mal irgendwo die BNF erklärt, mit der die SQL-Syntax definiert wurde, geschweige denn alle Optionen, die die SQL-Kommandos anbeiten (wie für Tabelle anlegen, Tabellenfeld definieren etc.). Es nicht möglich in dem Chaos mit vernünftigem Aufwand die Info zu finden, falls vorhanden, die benötigt wird, um weiter zu kommen. Das BASIC (????) habe ich noch gar nicht angefasst & dazu habe ich auch gar keine Lust mehr. Ich nehm' jetzt Python mit Django/Flask oder sowas und eine richtige Datenbank.
Es bueno para realizar bases de datos pequeñas (y no tan pequeñas). De vez en cuando peta cuando está diseñando formularios, pero por lo demás, va bien.
De lo mejor en Ofimatica
Uso Libreoffice desde hace años, yla recomiendo a mis amigos y clientes.
Hoy instalé Libreoffice, pero intento abrir Base y no sucede nada. Necesito ayuda pero no la encuentro. Soy nueva en Ubuntu, así que agradeceré mucho toda la ayuda que me puedan dar.
Es muy buena como base de datos¡¡¡
summary: Para que funcione, hay que instalar Java¡¡¡

Uso Ubuntu 20.04 y por más que trato de investigar por qué pasa esto no doy con la clave.

No sé si es cosa de Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS o si es cosa de Libreoffice base. El caso es que, en cuanto lo dejas 5 min abierto sin utilizar, se reinicia y pierdes toda la información. Acabo de introducir 130 registros y los he perdido.
No la usaré más. No me sirve...
summary: Se cierra a cada rato y se pierde la información
